text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This section contains information on procedures and administrative matters relative to Audit reconsideration.
MATERIAL CHANGES

IRM 4.13.2.2 Function Responsible & Routing Instructions, Revised routing instructions in para (1) and (2) and added note after para (2). Updated procedures in para (3)(d) and (e) and added new (3)(f). Updated Appeals phone number in para (6)(b) and updated procedures in table in (6)(d). Added Note to end of (6)(d).

IRM 4.13.2.3 Role of Contact Employees when a Reconsideration Request is Received and the Examination was Performed in the Area Office or Campus Examination Function, Deleted references to exhibits, updated Note in para (1)(a) and added clarifying content
IRM 4.13.2.3.1 Adoption Credit and American Opportunity Credit, Deleted First Time Homebuyer Credit content and replaced with Adoption Credit and American Opportunity Credit content.
IRM 4.13.2.4 Reconsideration Calls Received in Exam Operation, Updated procedures in para (2). Added new paragraph procedure to end of para (5)

EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This material supersedes IRM 4.13.2 dated, 12-31-2009. This section contains information on procedures and administrative matters relative to Audit Reconsideration.
Small Business/Self Employed and Wage and Investment Campus, Customer Account Services Appeals, Taxpayer Advocate Service
Table of Contents
This chapter discusses the role of contact employees. Contact employees (Customer Service Walk
In and Toll
Free call sites, Examination, Accounts Management, etc.) who receive inquiries from taxpayers regarding disagree
ment with additional tax assessments and/or reversal of tax credits such as Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC), will be responsible for responding to
Note: Wage and Investment (W&I) Examination Telephone Assistors are not sidered contact employees. See IRM
, Reconsideration Calls Received in Exam Operation, for procedures applicable to telephone assistors.

Use the following criteria to screen requests: a. The Taxpayer has filed an individual income tax return, and the examina- tion has been completed and assessed, and b. The taxpayer has a copy of the report or knows what issues he/she is contesting, and c. The taxpayer does not agree with the assessment and/or reversal of tax credits, such as EITC, and d. The taxpayer has new additional information that was not previously con- sidered, that would change the assessment/tax credit reversal. Additional information can include taxpayer explanation or testimony that was not previously documented and considered, as well as additional source documents that were not previously considered, and e. The assessment remains unpaid or as a result of the examination the tax credit(s) are reversed. (
) If all of the above apply, See IRM
, Function Responsible and Instructions, to identify the function responsible for originating the (

) Cases not meeting the above criteria should be processed as follows: a. If a return has not been filed by the taxpayer, advise taxpayer to send a complete, signed tax return. Inform taxpayer that the filing of a return is a requirement for reconsideration. b. If the taxpayer does not know what issues he/she are contesting and he/ she states they do not have or did not receive copy of the examination report, print a copy from Correspondence Examination Automation (CEAS)/Report Generation Software (RGS) (including Forms
) and mail to the taxpayer. Include Publication
If the case was not archived on CEAS/RGS or access to CEAS is not available, request a copy of the Examination Report and Publication
be sent to the taxpayer from the Returns and Income Verification System (RAIVS) unit via Form
C, see IRM
, Copies of Audit Reports. Advise the taxpayer to follow procedures in Publication

in reconsideration. Inform the taxpayer to include a home, cell or work number and a convenient time to call with his/her correspondence for the most efficient customer service. c. If the account is full paid and there have not been any credits reversed; the request is a claim for refund. Inform the taxpayer that he/she must follow claim procedures. Letter
C may be used for this purpose. Form
X and instructions as an enclosure. Along with the Letter
C and Form
X, return any documentation the taxpayer had attached to his/her correspondence.
The Taxpayer has filed an individual income tax return, and the examina

tion has been completed and assessed, and The taxpayer has a copy of the report or knows what issues he/she is contesting, and The taxpayer does not agree with the assessment and/or reversal of tax credits, such as EITC, and The taxpayer has new additional information that was not previously con

sidered, that would change the assessment/tax credit reversal. Additional information can include taxpayer explanation or testimony that was not previously documented and considered, as well as additional source documents that were not previously considered, and The assessment remains unpaid or as a result of the examination the tax credit(s) are reversed.
If all of the above apply, See IRM 4.13.2.2, Function Responsible and Routing Instructions, to identify the function responsible for originating the assessment.

d. If the case is currently open in Exam, and there is no assessment to the taxpayer’s account, advise the taxpayer to correspond with the office that has the open Exam. If the taxpayer provides correspondence, date stamp and forward the correspondence to the open control/office. e. If the taxpayer does not have any new additional information to support his/her position, which was not previously considered during the tion. New information can include taxpayer testimony and explanation was not previously documented and considered, as well as additional source documents that were not previously considered. If there is no information criteria for reconsideration is not met. f. If the taxpayer states he/she does not know what information can be submitted, issue Letter
C. Select the applicable paragraph to Form
, Disputed Issue Verification as an enclosure for the disputed issues and input the return address of the appropriate Exam CRU deter- mined by referring to IRM
, Routing of Campus Reconsideration Requests, IRM
, Routing of Area Office Reconsideration Requests, and IRM
, Central Reconsideration Unit (CRU) Addresses. g. If correspondence is received and the disputed issues cannot be identi- fied, send Letter
C. Select the applicable paragraph to include Form
, Disputed Issue Verification as an enclosure. Input return code of CRU determined by referring to IRM
, Routing of Reconsideration Requests, IRM
, Routing of Area Office Recon- sideration Requests, and IRM
, Central Reconsideration Unit (CRU) Addresses. h. If a loose Form
is received from an Accounts Management employee, return the correspondence to the originating stop number. Accounts Management is responsible for issuing the Letter
C to the taxpayer.

(6) UNDERREPORTER (AUR)

The assessment will be a TC 290 preceded by a TC 922. The originating campus may be determined from the address in the upper left corner of the CP 2000 (if available) or from the first two digits of the TC 922 DLN. If the first two digits of the TC 922 DLN are 07, 08, 18 or 89 it is a W&I taxpayer. If the first two digits of the TC 922 DLN are 19, 28 or 29 it is a SB/SE taxpayer. Correspondence requesting a reconsideration will be forwarded to the Campus where the assessment originated. A listing of addresses and contact phone numbers are available on SERP at Who/ Where: AUR Reconsideration Request Contact Information.
Note: Phone numbers on SERP are for internal contacts relating to AUR Reconsid- eration cases only.

Route taxpayer phone calls to AUR toll free numbers. The W&I toll free number is 1-800-829-3009 for TC 922 DLN beginning with 07, 08, 18 or 89. The SB/SE toll free number is 1-800-829-8310 for TC 922 DLN beginning with 19, 28 or 29.
a. The assessment will be a TC
preceded by another TC
for zero closing the case from Examination to Appeals. Next to the second TC
(Appeals assessment) will be a three digit Appeals Office code. (APPL- CD>

XX (docketed cases) when Appeals closes a case. The examiner in CRU must know the Appeals closing code to determine if the case will be forwarded to Appeals or worked in the CRU. The Appeals closing code can be determined by contacting the Appeals Account Resolution Special- ist (AARS) in Fresno at (
c. For AUR cases that went to Appeals, the TC
(Appeals assessment) with an Appeals office code will be preceded by a TC
Forward these cases to Appeals.

(Appeals assessment) with an Appeals Office code. Forward these cases to Appeals.

Exception: Forward TC 300 (Appeals assessment) that originated in ASFR to ASFR ONLY when there is an indication that the Appeals assessment was due to dismissal from Tax Court for Lack of Jurisdiction (LOJ).

X, it is in the best interest of the taxpayer if we work the case in the same campus. Multiple year requests should not be separated. (12-16-2015) Reconsideration Calls Received in Exam Operation
The taxpayer states that they have already sent in everything requested in Form
-H or previously issued Letter

C, the assistor will review the CEAS Audit Reconsideration workpapers to ascertain if the information previ- ously sent was determined by the examiner, to be complete and correct. If CEAS indicates that more information is needed, advise the taxpayer as to what additional information is needed. If the information previously sent was not sufficient to allow the deduction, advise the taxpayer why the reconsidera-

tion request was denied. If the taxpayer does not agree, listen to his/her explanation. Talk with the taxpayer about the possibility of providing documents that might support his/her position. If the taxpayer’s explanation includes information or perspective that was not previously considered and might change the determination or highlights a point in the previously submitted documentation that the examiner may have overlooked, suggest the taxpayer submit in writing the information he/she is providing on the If all the information the taxpayer has submitted was considered and the re- consideration issue(s) were disallowed, fully explain the reason why. If the taxpayer still does not agree, advise them of their right to appeal the and to reply to the letter sent to them notifying them of the partial/full ance. If the case is open on CEAS as Recon and the taxpayer insists on talking the assigned examiner after a full explanation was provided follow existing phone procedures in IRM
, Campus Examination Telephone to send CEAS Action Note. If the taxpayer is under a
or
Year Ban (PC
), and a reconsideration of EITC, inform the taxpayer they are under the
or
Ban and cannot claim EITC until the Ban expires. A recertification indicator for the “
” Year Ban or “
” for the
Year Ban will show on ENMOD, along with the year on which the Ban originated. If the taxpayer is contesting the
or

year ban, advise them to request audit reconsideration for the year the ban originated, and submit tion showing their EITC entitlement. Advise W & I taxpayers to forward their reconsideration request and documentation to Austin, and SB/SE taxpayers forward their reconsideration request and documentation to Brookhaven.

If the taxpayer is under a 2 or 10 Year Ban (PC 0697 & 0698), and requesting a reconsideration of EITC, inform the taxpayer they are under the 2 or 10 Year Ban and cannot claim EITC until the Ban expires. A recertification indicator of for the “2” Year Ban or “ 4” for the 10 Year Ban will show on ENMOD, along with the year on which the Ban originated.

If the taxpayer is contesting the 2 or 10 year ban, advise them to request an audit reconsideration for the year the ban originated, and submit documenta- tion showing their EITC entitlement. Advise W & I taxpayers to forward their reconsideration request and documentation to Austin, and SB/SE taxpayers to forward their reconsideration request and documentation to Brookhaven.
